messages.original: The remaining 4 groups of Kh-101s are flying towards Burshtyn Thermal Power Plant, Ivano-Frankivsk Oblast.

3 groups of Kh-101s are bypassing Burshtyn, flying to Zhydachiv, Lviv Oblast.
1 group changed course to Ternopil City.
Explosions in Ternopil City. Kh-101 impacts
Explosions in Lviv City. Kh-101 impacts.
More Kh-101s are flying to Lviv
Additional explosions were heard in Burshtyn, Ivano-Frankivsk Oblast earlier.
Explosions in Lviv City. Kh-101 impacts. All clear now.

The missile attack is now over. More than 50 missiles of various types were used. I will publish a full report + the consequences later on. 
If you wish to support my work, you can do so here: 
https://buymeacoffee.com/amk_mapping
. 
Thank you for following along.

Footage showing 3 Kh-101 cruise missiles and 4 Geran-2 drones impacted an industrial facility in Ternopil City.
At least 9 missiles attacked the city this morning.
Large fires are burning in Ternopil.
Large fires are burning in Ternopil.
An apartment building has received significant damage in Ternopil.
An apartment building has received significant damage in Ternopil.
Large fires are burning in Lviv City following Russian Geran-2 drone strikes. Missiles have since impacted the city too.
Large fires are burning in Lviv City following Russian Geran-2 drone strikes. Missiles have since impacted the city too.

Yesterday, a Russian Iskander-M ballistic missile struck a Ukrainian HIMARS position, destroying two GMLRS launchers near the village of Volos'ka Balakliya, Kharkiv Oblast.
These launchers were used to launch four ATACMS ballistic missiles at Voronezh yesterday, all of which were shot down by Russian S-400 air defence.

Last night, another large-scale, combined Russian missile and drone attack was carried out on Ukraine.
Missiles launched:
~24 Kh-101 cruise missiles from 4 Tu-160 strategic bombers at their launch lines over the Caspian Sea in Limansky District, Astrakhan Oblast.
~24 Kh-101 cruise missiles from 6 Tu-95MS strategic bombers at their launch lines near the village of Uzmore, Saratov Oblast.
~6 Kalibr cruise missiles from 1 "Admiral Makarov" Frigate off the coast of Cape Myskhako, Krasnodar Krai.  
~4 Kalibr cruise missiles from 1 "Varshavyanka" submarine off the coast of Cape Myskhako, Krasnodar Krai.
~3 Kh-22 cruise missiles from 3 Tu-22m3 strategic bombers at their launch lines in eastern Kursk Oblast.
~1 Iskander-M ballistic missile from an OTRK installation west of Kursk City, Kursk Oblast.
-----------------------
The main targets for this strike were Ukrainian energy and gas infrastructure. The following was hit:
Burshtyn Thermal Power Plant, Ivano-Frankivak Oblast (49.20971, 24.66424) by ~15 Kh-101s
Ladyzhyn Thermal Power Plant, Vinnytsia Oblast (48.70478, 29.22006) by 9 Kh-101s
Dashava Underground Gas Storage Facility, Lviv Oblast (49.40383, 23.89924) by ~9 Kalibrs and 4 Kalibrs
Rozdil electrical substation, Lviv Oblast (49.46044, 24.14668) by ~5 Kh-101s
Unknown gas infrastructure target near Lubny, Poltava Oblast by ~3 Kh-22 cruise missiles.
Unknown industrial facility in Ternopil City by ~9 Kh-101s.
Unknown target in/near Lviv City by ~6 Kh-101s.
Unknown target in Dnipro, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast by ~4 Kalibrs.
Unknown target in Berestyn, Kharkiv Oblast by ~1 Iskander-M.
-----------------------
Additional places targeted by Geran-2 drones, but not by missiles, include:
Kharkiv City, Kharkiv Oblast.
Sumy City, Sumy Oblast
Odesa City, Odesa Oblast.
Zlatopil area, Kharkiv Oblast.
Bohodukhiv area, Kharkiv Oblast.
Balakliya area, Kharkiv Oblast.
Keep in mind, the numbers of missiles launched may be slightly higher than what I've listed, as the number of missiles detected is often lower than actual launches.
Large fires are burning in Lviv City following Russian Geran-2 drone strikes. Missiles have since impacted the city too.
A warehouse facility has received significant damage in Lviv.

Russian forces have recaptured the village of Volodymyrivka, Dobropillya direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~675.
Total land area: ~2.03 km¬≤.

Russian forces have captured the village of Vovche, Pokrovsk'e direction, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~13.
Total land area: ~0.16 km¬≤.
Military Situation In Ukraine On November 18, 2025 (Maps Update)
Military Situation In Ukraine On November 18, 2025 (Maps Update)

Ukraine Is Losing More Ground In Kharkiv (Videos)
On November 18, the Russian military captured another settlement close to Vovchansk and made additional gains in the city of Kupyansk in Kharkiv.
The Sever [North] Group of Forces imposed control of Tsegelnoye, located right to the southwest of Vovchansk, according to the Russian Ministry of Defense.
The capture of the settlement is very important for Russian military operations in this part of Kharkiv. From there, the Sever Group of Forces could attack Vil‚Äôcha to the south. This would put immense pressure on remaining Ukrainian troops in the southeastern part of Vovchansk.
The pressure on Kiev forces is even larger to the south in Kharkiv, specifically in Kupyansk, where the Zapad Group of Forces has been making gains on a daily basis.
Read more

A Reckoning for Ukraine's Spy Chief: Budanov's Ambitions Clash With Battlefield Realities
A chronology of the Ukrainian Main Intelligence Directorate's special forces' suicidal landing. The Black Hawk-style operation ended in disaster. Despite efforts made, success was not achieved.
Over the past few months, the operational crisis facing Ukrainian troops in the Pokrovsk and Mirnograd area has perhaps become the most critical point on the entire front. Despite the advance of Russian units, Ukrainian commanders claimed that the situation was under control. However, it later emerged that Pokrovsk had fallen and that a group of several thousand well-trained Ukrainian paratroopers and marines had become isolated from the main forces in Mirnograd.
Losing such combat-ready units would seriously impact the entire front line. Consequently, the Ukrainian command deployed almost all available forces to relieve the besieged garrison.
üëâ

RUSSIA'S EXPANDING OFFENSIVE: PREVIOUSLY QUIET FRONTS SEE COMBAT

Russian Army Enters Siversk: Operations Against Ukrainian Forces Inside City Began¬†
Russian forces have taken control of the Nechayevka settlement in the Zaporizhzhia sector. The Russian army has advanced 900 metres towards Siversk , entering the southern part of the city. 
Meanwhile, British diplomat Ian Proud stated that France is unlikely to transfer Rafale fighter jets to Ukraine in the near future.
